title: Antenna
definition: The appendage that is composed of ringlike sclerites and the anatomical structures encircled by these sclerites and that is articulated with the cranium.

title: Antennal scrobe
definition: The scrobe that is located dorsally of the antennal foramen and is for the reception of the antenna.

title: Antennomere
definition: The anatomical structure that is delimited by the proximal and distal margins of the antennal sclerite.

title: Anterior propodeal projection
definition: The projection that is located submedially on the anterior margin of the propodeum.

title: Basal vein
definition: The wing vein that is basally located on the fore wing and connects or nearly connects the submarginal vein and the medial plus cubital veins.

title: Clava
definition: The anatomical cluster that is composed of apical flagellomeres bearing multiporous plates in female organism.

title: Clavomere
definition: The flagellomere that is located in the clava.

title: Clypeus
definition: The area that corresponds to the site of origin of the clypeo-epipharyngeal muscle.

title: Condyle
definition: The articular surface that is convex and is inserted into the fossa of an adjacent sclerite.

title: Episternal foveae
definition: The row of impressions that is located on the anteroventral edge of the mesopleuron and is correspond to the site of origin of the mesopleuro-mesobasalar muscle.

title: Facial striae
definition: The anatomical cluster anterior to the malar sulcus that is composed of carinae radiating from the pleurostomal condyle.

title: Felt field
definition: The setiferous patch that is located sublaterally on an abdominal sternum.

title: Femoral depression
definition: The scrobe that is located on the mesopleuron into which the mesofemur fits when pressed against the mesosoma.

title: Foramen
definition: The anatomical space that is surrounded by sclerites and allows for the passage of haemolymph, nerves and tracheae.

title: Forewing
definition: The wing that is located on the mesothorax.

title: Frons
definition: The area that is between the epistomal line and the anterior ocellus and limited laterally by the inner margin of compound eye.

title: Frontal depression
definition: The anatomical cluster that is composed of antennal scrobes.

title: Gena
definition: The area that is delimited by the intersection of the interorbital plane, the margin of the compound eye, the margin of the oral foramen, the occipital carina and the malar sulcus.

title: Head
definition: The tagma that is located anterior to the thorax.

title: Hindwing
definition: The wing that is located on the metathorax.

title: Horn of T1
definition: The area that is located anteriorly on mediotergum 1, is raised and contains the proximal part of the retracted ovipositor

title: Interantennal process
definition: The area that is elevated and extends between the toruli.

title: Lateral propodeal area
definition: The area that is located laterally on the propodeum, is delimited posteromedially by the lateral propodeal carina and is delimited laterally by the plica.

title: Malar striae
definition: The anatomical cluster posterior to the malar sulcus that is composed of carinae radiating from the pleurostomal condyle.

title: Malar sulcus
definition: The sulcus that extends between the ventral margin of the compound eye and the base of the mandible.

title: Mandible
definition: The appendage that is encircled by one sclerite that is connected to the cranium proximolaterally and to the maxillo-labial complex proximomedially via conjunctivae and articulates with the cranium via the anterior and posterior cranio-mandibular articulations.

title: Margin
definition: The line that delimits the periphery of an area.

title: Mesepimeral sulcus
definition: The sulcus that extends along the posterior margin of the mesopectus, delimits the mesepimeral area and corresponds to the mesepimeral ridge.

title: Mesonotum
definition: The area that is limited anteriorly by the pronotum, laterally by the basalare, axillary sclerites, subalare and the mesopectus and posterolaterally by the mesopostnotum and the metanotum.

title: Mesopleural carina
definition: The carina that crosses the mesopleuron and limits ventrally the femoral depression.

title: Mesopleural pit
definition: The pleural pit that is located on the mesopleuron.

title: Mesopleuron
definition: The pleuron that is located in the mesothorax.

title: Mesoscutal suprahumeral sulcus
definition: The sulcus that extends along the anterior margin of the mesoscutum between the anterior-most point of the preaxilla and the anteroadmedian line and corresponds to the vertical lobe of the mesoscutum.

title: Mesoscutellum
definition: The scutellum that is located on the mesonotum.

title: Mesoscutum
definition: The scutum that is located on the mesonotum.

title: Mesosoma
definition: The anatomical cluster that is composed of the prothorax, mesothorax and the metapectal-propodeal complex.

title: Metanotal trough
definition: The area that is concave, and is delimited medially by the metascutellum, laterally by the supraalar area and posteriorly by the metascutellar arm.

title: Metapleural sulcus
definition: The line that corresponds with the metapleural ridge.

title: Metapleural triangle
definition: The area that is located anteroventrally on the metapectus, is delimited ventrally by the ventral carina of the metapleuron and is triangular.

title: Metapleuron
definition: The area of the metapectal-propodeal complex that is limited ventrally by the ventral carina of the metapleuron and dorsally by the metapleural carina.

title: Metascutellum
definition: The area that is located posteromedially on the metanotum, is delimited laterally by the metanotal trough and corresponds to the reservoir of the dorsal vessel.

title: Metasoma
definition: The tagma that is connected anteriorly to the metapectal-propodeal complex at the propodeal foramen and consists of abdominal segments.

title: Metasomal depression
definition: The acetabulum that is concave, surrounds the nucha and accommodates the base of the metasoma.

title: Notaulus
definition: The line that extends submedially along the mesoscutum and corresponds to the median border of the site of origin of the first mesopleuro-mesonotal muscle.

title: Occipital carina
definition: The carina that surrounds dorsolaterally the occiput.

title: Ovipositor
definition: The anatomical cluster that is composed of the first valvulae, second valvulae, third valvulae, first valvifers, second valvifers and female T9.

title: Pleurostomal condyle
definition: The condyle that is located on the anterior (dorsal) margin of the pleurostoma and inserts into the mandibular acetabulum.

title: Postacetabular sulcus
definition: The sulcus that extends posteriorly along the epicnemial carina.

title: Posterior mesepimeral area
definition: The area that extends along the posterior margin of the mesopleuron and is delimited anteriorly by the mesepimeral sulcus.

title: Posterior propodeal projection
definition: The propodeal spine that is located posteromedially of the first abdominal spiracle.

title: Postgena
definition: The area that is located on the occiput ventrally of the occipital foramen.

title: Postmarginal vein
definition: The abscissa that is marginal and located distal to the marginal vein.

title: Prespecular sulcus
definition: The sulcus that delimits anteriorly the speculum and corresponds to the anterior margin of the speculum.

title: Pronotal cervical sulcus
definition: The sulcus that extends along the anterior margin of the pronotum and delimits the anterior rim of pronotum.

title: Pronotal suprahumeral sulcus
definition: The sulcus that extends along the dorsal margin of the pronotum and delimits the dorsal pronotal area.

title: Pronotum
definition: The notum that is located in the prothorax.

title: Sensillum
definition: A sense organ embedded in the integument and consisting of one or a cluster of sensory neurons and associated sensory structures, support cells and glial cells forming a single organized unit with a largely bona fide boundary.

title: Skaphion
definition: The area that is anteriorly on the mesonotum and delimited posteriorly by the skaphion carina.

title: Spine
definition: The process that lacks non-sclerotised ring at the base.

title: Submarginal vein
definition: Basal-most portion of the forewing vein complex that occurs behind the costal cell; measured from the constriction that delimits the humeral plate to the point at which the vein touches the leading edge of the wing apically.

title: Submedian carina
definition: The carina that arises from the anterior mandibular articulation that is located medially of the orbital carina and laterally of the frontal carina.

title: Sulcus
definition: The groove that corresponds to a ridge.

title: Tergite
definition: The sclerite that is located on the tergum.

title: Transverse pronotal carina
definition: The carina that delimits posteriorly the pronotal neck.

title: Acetabular carina
definition: The carina that delimits posteriorly the epicnemium.

title: Antecostal sulcus
definition: The sulcus that corresponds to the antecosta.

title: Antennal foramen
definition: The foramen that is located on the head in which the radicle is positioned.

title: Axillar crescent
definition: The anatomical cluster composed of the transaxillar carina, axillar carina, and axillular carina.

title: Axillular carina
definition: The axillular line that is a carina.

title: Eye
definition: The compound organ that is composed of ommatidia.

title: Flagellum
definition: The anatomical cluster composed of flagellomeres.

title: Genal carina
definition: The carina that extends on the gena from the lateral margin of the oral foramen.

title: Hyperoccipital carina
definition: The carina that extends on the vertex between the outer orbits.

title: Inner orbit
definition: The line that extends along the border between the eye and face.

title: Lateral ocellus
definition: The ocellus that is paired.

title: Laterotergite
definition: The area that is located laterally on the tergum and is delimited by a longitudinal edge.

title: Median mesoscutal sulcus
definition: The sulcus that is located in the anteroposterior midline of the mesoscutum and corresponds with the median mesoscutal ridge.

title: Mediotergite
definition: The area that is located medially on the tergum and is separated laterally by a line from the laterotergite.

title: Mesepisternum
definition: The area that is located anteriorly of the mesepimeral sulcus.

title: Mesocoxa
definition: The coxa that is located on the mid leg.

title: Mesopleural epicoxal sulcus
definition: The epicoxal sulcus that is located on the mesopleuron.

title: Mesoscutal humeral sulcus
definition: The sulcus that extends medially along the parascutal carina and corresponds to a shallow ridge.

title: Metacoxa
definition: The coxa that is located on the hind leg.

title: Metanotum
definition: The alinotum that is located in the metathorax, is connected with the mesoscutellum and the mesopostnotum anteriorly and the acrotergite of the first abdominal tergum posteromedially.

title: Metapleural carina
definition: The carina that delimits the metapleuron dorsally from the propodeum, extends from just ventral of the metapleural arm to the metacoxal articulation and passes anteroventral to the propodeal spiracle.

title: Metapostnotum
definition: The area that is located anterior to the antecostal sulcus of the first abdominal tergum.

title: Mouthparts
definition: The anatomical cluster that is composed of the labrum, epipharyngeal wall, hypopharyngeal wall (including the sitophore), mandibles, maxillae, labium and conjunctivae connecting them.

title: Netrion
definition: The area that is located posteroventrally on the pronotum and corresponds to the site of origin of first flexor of the fore wing muscle.

title: Netrion sulcus
definition: The sulcus that  anteriorly delimits the netrion.

title: Occiput
definition: The area that is concave and surrounds the postocciput.

title: Ocellus
definition: The multi-tissue structure that is located on the top of the head, composed of the corneal lens, pigment cell, rhabdoms and synaptic plexus.

title: Orbital furrow
definition: The impression that arises laterally from the antennal rim and extends along the inner margin of the compound eye.

title: Paracoxal sulcus
definition: The sulcus that corresponds to the paracoxal ridge.

title: Preocellar pit
definition: The pit that is located on upper face adjacent the anterior margin of the median ocellus and corresponds internally to a conical apodeme and not the tentorium.

title: Procoxa
definition: The coxa that is located on the fore leg.

title: Propleuron
definition: The pleuron that is articulated with the fore leg, connected dorsolaterally (anterolaterally) with the pronotum and ventrally (posteriorly) with the prosternum.

title: Propodeal spiracle
definition: The abdominal spiracle that is the anteriormost in the body.

title: Propodeum
definition: The area of the metapectal-propodeal complex that is located posterior to the metapleural carina.

title: Radicle
definition: The area that is located proximally on the scape, is limited distally by a constriction and bears proximally the basal knob.

title: Scape
definition: The antennal segment that is proximal to the pedicel and is connected to the head via the radicle.

title: Sclerite
definition: The area of the integument that is strongly sclerotised, with thick exocuticle and is surrounded by conjunctivae.

title: Sculpture
definition: The area that is located on the sclerite and that is composed of repetitive anatomical structures.

title: Speculum
definition: The area that is located dorsally on the mesopleuron, is delimited posteriorly by the mesepimeral ridge and corresponds to the site of origin of the dorsal mesopleuro-mesofurcal muscle.

title: Spiracle
definition: The anatomical cluster that is composed of the distal end of the trachea and the margin of the sclerite or conjunctiva surrounding the spiracular opening.

title: Tegula
definition: The sclerite that is located laterally of the preaxilla and obscures the anterior mesonoto-first axillary articulation and the mesopleuro-second axillary sclerite joints.

title: Vertex
definition: The area that is delimited by the intersection of the margin of the compound eyes, the interorbital plane, and the anatomical line that is tangential to the point on the margin of the anterior ocellus which defines the minimum distance between the anterior ocellus and the oral foramen.

title: Wing
definition: The area that is located in between the notum and the pleuron and is composed of the wing base and wing blade.

title: Wing base
definition: The anatomical cluster that is composed of the pteralia, humeral complex, tegula and axillary cord.
